message_1: What is the logical formula that represents the statement "It is always sunny in California during the summer months"?
message_2:
Let S(x) represent "it is sunny in California on day x" and M(x) represent "day x is a summer month in California." The logical formula representing the statement "It is always sunny in California during the summer months" can be written as:

∀x (M(x) → S(x))

This formula states that for all days x, if x is a summer month in California, then it is sunny in California on day x.
